Yes, the styling tool you once thought was only relegated to stick-straight strands can &lt;em&gt;also&lt;\/em&gt; give you curls. NOW","published":"1418155500","type":"VIDEO","basename":"76612","pages":"1","status":"PUBLISHED","body":"If the manis on the spring '15 runways were any indication, nail art is &lt;a href=\"\/new-nail-art-trends-fashion-week\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;here to &lt;em&gt;stay&lt;\/em&gt;&lt;\/a&gt;. And, for good reason. One of the biggest and most innovative trends we saw everywhere from Delpozo to Kye to Creatures of Comfort was the use of negative space \u2014 the space on your tips &lt;em&gt;not&lt;\/em&gt; covered by nail polish, that is. So, why not get a head start a season early and perfect your mani for the holiday circuit? &lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;\n\n\nAbove, our model uses a bit of tape, an Xacto knife (or you can just use a pair of scissors!), and lacquers from the new &lt;a href=\"http:\/\/ad.doubleclick.net\/ddm\/clk\/286214557;111512756;e\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow\"&gt;OPI&lt;\/a&gt; Gwen Stefani Holiday Collection for a geometric mani that only &lt;em&gt;looks&lt;\/em&gt; hard to DIY. In reality, the hardest thing about this look is choosing two contrasting colors for the wow-factor that'll have everyone at the party inspecting your tips. We used Rollin' In Cashmere with First Class Desires here, but Love is Hot and Coal with Kiss Me \u2014 Or Elf! is just as good. Now, click play, and beat the trendsetters at their own game. \n\n\n \n\n\n&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;em&gt;&lt;small&gt;Written by Jada Wong, Beauty Expertise by Annie Tomlin, Nail Expertise by Miss Pop, Styled by Willow Lindley, Shot by Ryan Stumpe, Shot by Giga Shane, Edited by Amanda Madden, Hair and Makeup by Marie Guthrie, Photographed by Jessica Nash.&lt;\/small&gt;&lt;\/em&gt;\n\n&lt;img src=\"http:\/\/ad.doubleclick.net\/ad\/N5371.127806.REFINERY29.COM\/B8263402.111512757;sz=1x1;ord=[timestamp]?\" border=\"0\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" alt=\"Advertisement\"&gt;","sections":{"body":[{"type":"text","content":"If the manis on the spring '15 runways were any indication, nail art is &lt;a href=\"http:\/\/www.refinery29.com\/new-nail-art-trends-fashion-week\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;here to &lt;em&gt;stay&lt;\/em&gt;&lt;\/a&gt;. And, for good reason. One of the biggest and most innovative trends we saw everywhere from Delpozo to Kye to Creatures of Comfort was the use of negative space \u2014 the space on your tips &lt;em&gt;not&lt;\/em&gt; covered by nail polish, that is. So, why not get a head start a season early and perfect your mani for the holiday circuit? &lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;\n\n\nAbove, our model uses a bit of tape, an Xacto knife (or you can just use a pair of scissors!), and lacquers from the new &lt;a href=\"http:\/\/ad.doubleclick.net\/ddm\/clk\/286214557;111512756;e\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;OPI&lt;\/a&gt; Gwen Stefani Holiday Collection for a geometric mani that only &lt;em&gt;looks&lt;\/em&gt; hard to DIY. In reality, the hardest thing about this look is choosing two contrasting colors for the wow-factor that'll have everyone at the party inspecting your tips. We used Rollin' In Cashmere with First Class Desires here, but Love is Hot and Coal with Kiss Me \u2014 Or Elf! is just as good. Now, click play, and beat the trendsetters at their own game. \n\n\n \n\n\n&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;em&gt;&lt;small&gt;Written by Jada Wong, Beauty Expertise by Annie Tomlin, Nail Expertise by Miss Pop, Styled by Willow Lindley, Shot by Ryan Stumpe, Shot by Giga Shane, Edited by Amanda Madden, Hair and Makeup by Marie Guthrie, Photographed by Jessica Nash.&lt;\/small&gt;&lt;\/em&gt;\n\n&lt;img src=\"http:\/\/ad.doubleclick.net\/ad\/N5371.127806.REFINERY29.COM\/B8263402.111512757;sz=1x1;ord=[timestamp]?\" border=\"0\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" alt=\"Advertisement\"&gt;"}],"slideshow":[],"featured_video":{"type":"video:internal","content":{"entry_asset_id":"494807","resource":"p5cXNkcToEYoO8wkFK-OhinuzNbVuE4y","alignment":"","description":"","credit":"Photographed by Jessica Nash.","impressiontracker":"","preview_image":{"src":"\/\/s2.r29static.com\/\/bin\/asset\/a4f\/xn\/1314809\/image.png","original_width_px":"1920","original_height_px":"1080"},"products":[]}}},"sections_count":2,"excerpt":"If the manis on the spring '15 runways were any indication, nail art is &lt;a href=\"http:\/\/www.refinery29.com\/new-nail-art-trends-fashion-week\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;here to &lt;em&gt;stay&lt;\/em&gt;&lt;\/a&gt;. And, for good reason. One of the biggest and most innovative trends we saw everywhere from Delpozo to Kye to Creatures of Comfort was the use of negative space \u2014 the space on your tips &lt;em&gt;not&lt;\/em&gt; covered by nail polish, that is. So, why not get a head start a season early and perfect your mani for the holiday circuit? &lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt; Above, our model uses a bit of tape, an Xacto knife (or you can just use a pair of scissors!), and lacquers from the new &lt;a href=\"http:\/\/www.opi.com\/\"&gt;OPI&lt;\/a&gt; Gwen Stefani Holiday Collection for a geometric mani that only &lt;em&gt;looks&lt;\/em&gt; hard to DIY. In reality, the hardest thing about this look is choosing two contrasting colors for the wow-factor that'll have everyone at the party inspecting your tips. We used Rollin' In Cashmere with First Class Desires here, but Love is Hot and Coal with Kiss Me \u2014 Or Elf! is just as good. Now, click play, and beat the trendsetters at their own game. &lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;em&gt;&lt;small&gt;Written by Jada Wong, Beauty Expertise by Annie Tomlin, Nail Expertise by Miss Pop, Styled by Willow Lindley, Shot by Ryan Stumpe, Shot by Giga Shane, Edited by Amanda Madden, Hair and Makeup by Marie Guthrie, Photographed by Jessica Nash.&lt;\/small&gt;&lt;\/em&gt;","paginated_body":"If the manis on the spring '15 runways were any indication, nail art is &lt;a href=\"\/new-nail-art-trends-fashion-week\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;here to &lt;em&gt;stay&lt;\/em&gt;&lt;\/a&gt;. And, for good reason. One of the biggest and most innovative trends we saw everywhere from Delpozo to Kye to Creatures of Comfort was the use of negative space \u2014 the space on your tips &lt;em&gt;not&lt;\/em&gt; covered by nail polish, that is. So, why not get a head start a season early and perfect your mani for the holiday circuit? &lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;\n\n\nAbove, our model uses a bit of tape, an Xacto knife (or you can just use a pair of scissors!), and lacquers from the new &lt;a href=\"http:\/\/ad.doubleclick.net\/ddm\/clk\/286214557;111512756;e\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow\"&gt;OPI&lt;\/a&gt; Gwen Stefani Holiday Collection for a geometric mani that only &lt;em&gt;looks&lt;\/em&gt; hard to DIY. In reality, the hardest thing about this look is choosing two contrasting colors for the wow-factor that'll have everyone at the party inspecting your tips. We used Rollin' In Cashmere with First Class Desires here, but Love is Hot and Coal with Kiss Me \u2014 Or Elf! is just as good. entered a new era of nail art. For the most part (at least outside of Instagram), gone are the days of the super elaborate mani; dangling charms, 3-D kittens, and miniature landscapes have been replaced instead by less in-your-face designs. This is a more refined, subtle way to decorate your digits \u2014 one that grabs attention not by shouting, but by captivating with its subtlety. Incognito nail art, if you will.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;\n\nOne of our favorite iterations of this new wave of nails is the Flipped Mani. First brought to the mainstream with Adele's now-infamous &lt;a href=\"\/new-louboutin-nail-trend\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;Louboutin look&lt;\/a&gt;, this stealth mani features a two-color nail \u2014 one hue on the front, and a corresponding or contrasting hue on the back underside of the nail. The result is a manicure that looks deceptively simple, but will have people grabbing your hands mid-conversation to more closely examine your sneaky duo-tone.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;\n\nIntrigued? appointment for a weekly DIY project at home. It's more convenient, &lt;em&gt;way&lt;\/em&gt; cheaper, and gives us the opportunity to perfect our painting skills. On any given Sunday night, we're hunched over our digits in hopes of smudge-free, shiny tips that will last 'til Friday. But, come Hump Day, our nails are mysteriously chipped, nicked, or scratched. &lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;\n\nWhile we all know gels last longer than regular lacquers, the thought of enduring a tedious salon appointment so a technician can apply and take off the difficult-to-remove polish has us running in the opposite direction. That's why we're sort of dying over &lt;a href=\"http:\/\/ad.doubleclick.net\/ddm\/clk\/283833900;110681967;k\" rel=\"nofollow\" target=\"_blank\"&gt;Sally Hansen\u00ae Miracle Gel\u2122&lt;\/a&gt; \u2014 a two-step at-home gel polish that results in up to 14 days of color and shine without the need for UV lamps.\n\n\n &lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt; \nWatch above to see how you can ace your next paint job with the Miracle Gel\u2122 color and top coat, and then have your own glorious Sunday as you give yourself a chip-free gel mani in your jammies. Beauty"]}},{"id":"74229","title":"Bye-Bye, Summer Nails: Fall's Coolest Colors Are Here","published":"1412098500","type":"VIDEO","basename":"74229","pages":"1","status":"PUBLISHED","body":"When it comes to manicures, we're betting you've got a signature polish shade \u2014 the go-to hue you revert to when mulling over lacquers at the salon or even when you're home. Well, regardless of how comfortable you are with your coral pinks or pinky nudes, fall's newest color lineup is too good to &lt;em&gt;not&lt;\/em&gt; switch camps. \n&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;\n\nSpanning every shade under the sun, the &lt;a href=\"http:\/\/ad.doubleclick.net\/ddm\/clk\/283833900;110681967;k\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow\"&gt;Sally Hansen\u00ae Miracle Gel\u2122&lt;\/a&gt; fall collection is a treasure trove for nail polish lovers. And, since it doesn't need a UV light, all you have to do is apply two coats of your favorite shade, finish with the Miracle Gel\u2122 Top Coat, and admire your chip-free handiwork for up to 14 days of color and shine. move you could do every day that would make your skin look more radiant, smooth, and lifted? Sounds like hocus-pocus, but that's exactly what &lt;a href=\"\/facial-massage#slide\"&gt;facial massage&lt;\/a&gt; does. &lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;\n\nJust as a body massage makes you feel relaxed and rejuvenated, massaging your skin helps soften fine lines, increase circulation, and minimize puffiness, and it even helps make your skin-care products work more efficiently. More than any lotion, potion, or elixir, facial massage is really the must-try trick that makes our skin its glowy, most gorgeous best.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;\n\nSpas have been incorporating facial massage into their complexion treatments for years, which explains why our skin always looks so amazing after a visit to our aesthetician. But, how to do this ancient beauty ritual at home? There aren't many tutorials out there, and it can be daunting for a newbie. &lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;\n\nLook no further, as we've got your beginner's guide to facial massage right here. Watch as the lovely Julie shows you two of the most common massage techniques and gives you the play-by-play on how to do them at home, no spa or aesthetician required. - Beauty"]}},{"id":"67010","title":"The Perfect Shadow For Your Eye Color","published":"1404758100","type":"VIDEO","basename":"67010","pages":"1","status":"PUBLISHED","body":"Every day we're faced with color choices \u2014 from our outfit to our kicks to our nails. And, the combo we whip up says &lt;em&gt;a lot&lt;\/em&gt;. The same goes for makeup. There may be a time and place for a fierce purple lip and bright-orange eyeshadow, but there's also the rest of the time \u2014 when we just want to work what we got. That's when we lean toward eyeshadows that spotlight (not sabotage) our natural features by complementing our hair and eye color.\n&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;\nNot sure where to begin? We'll walk you through it all in the tutorial above, and before you know it, you'll be slicking on the &lt;em&gt;right&lt;\/em&gt; shade. Because whether you have brown-eyed beauties or icy baby blues, our model Jordan knows which colors from Almay's line of Shadow Softies\u2122 by Intense i-Color\u2122 will make your peepers really pop. &lt;em&gt;Hello&lt;\/em&gt;, bright eyes.\n\n  ","sections":{"body":[{"type":"text","content":"Every day we're faced with color choices \u2014 from our outfit to our kicks to our nails. And, the combo we whip up says &lt;em&gt;a lot&lt;\/em&gt;. The same goes for makeup. There may be a time and place for a fierce purple lip and bright-orange eyeshadow, but there's also the rest of the time \u2014 when we just want to work what we got. That's when we lean toward eyeshadows that spotlight (not sabotage) our natural features by complementing our hair and eye color.\n&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;\nNot sure where to begin? The same goes for makeup. There may be a time and place for a fierce purple lip and bright-orange eyeshadow, but there's also the rest of the time \u2014 when we just want to work what we got. That's when we lean toward eyeshadows that spotlight (not sabotage) our natural features by complementing our hair and eye color.\n&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;\nNot sure where to begin? We'll walk you through it all in the tutorial above, and before you know it, you'll be slicking on the &lt;em&gt;right&lt;\/em&gt; shade. -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased;}.price-tag:before {content: \"\\77\";}\n&lt;\/style&gt;","paginated_body":"The cat-eye is a classic beauty look and for good reason. Not only does it add a feminine touch to your peepers, but it also enhances your entire face and gives it an instant lift. Unfortunately, it's also one of the hardest to perfect. No matter how stable our hands are, how smooth our eyeliner formula is, or how many times we start from scratch, we just can't seem to get that tiny wing &lt;em&gt;just&lt;\/em&gt; right. Well, not anymore.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;\n\nFollow the tutorial above as our model nails the feline flick with an Almay Intense i-Color Defining Liner\u2122 and Intense i-Color Liquid Eyeliner\u2122. Okay, there's a makeup-eraser stick involved but, hey, practice &lt;em&gt;and&lt;\/em&gt; makeup remover make perfect, right? Our complexion could always use some brightening, and our lashes will never turn down a little definition before we head out the door. Relegated to the gym or as the go-to hairstyle for girls that don't know what else to do with their manes when they start acting up, the humble pony doesn't get nearly the kind of attention and acclaim as its sister 'dos, braids and beachy waves.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;\n\nWell, we say pshaw to this notion, pshaw we say! &lt;strong&gt;There's no reason ponytails can't be as chic and worthy of taking center stage&lt;\/strong&gt;. Ward Schorsch"],"channels":["beauty","Makeup"],"tags":["VIDEO","Facebook","Twitter"]}},{"id":"65862","title":"3, 2, 1: Cover Up Blemishes In A Snap","published":"1401228300","type":"VIDEO","basename":"65862","pages":"1","status":"PUBLISHED","body":"Anyone with problematic skin can attest that covering up blemishes and blotches is usually a grueling routine that involves layering products \u00e0 la Lady M's Mille Cr\u00eapes cake. But, piling on the camo-level concealer and thick foundation can actually smother your complexion and lead to more breakouts and increased oil production. Good thing we've figured out how to hide imperfections without covering &lt;em&gt;everything&lt;\/em&gt; up.\n&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;\nHere's the trick: Apply lightweight products with skin-clearing ingredients sparingly so your mug can breathe. Watch the video above for three easy steps to cover blemishes using Almay's Clear Complexion\u2122 line of double-duty goodies that provide instant coverage while treating those embarrassing specks. Now, just hit play. \n\n\n&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;em&gt;&lt;small&gt;Makeup expertise by Theo Kogan; Beauty contribution by Annie Tomlin, Styled by Melissa Ward Schorsch, Photographed by Lauren Perlstein, Shot by Jack Pearce, Shot by Kenny Wu, Edited by Chris Beer.&lt;\/small&gt;&lt;\/em&gt; \n\n\n","sections":{"body":[{"type":"text","content":"Anyone with problematic skin can attest that covering up blemishes and blotches is usually a grueling routine that involves layering products \u00e0 la Lady M's Mille Cr\u00eapes cake. But, piling on the camo-level concealer and thick foundation can actually smother your complexion and lead to more breakouts and increased oil production. Good thing we've figured out how to hide imperfections without covering &lt;em&gt;everything&lt;\/em&gt; up.\n&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;\nHere's the trick: Apply lightweight products with skin-clearing ingredients sparingly so your mug can breathe. NOW","published":"1400796300","type":"VIDEO","basename":"66617","pages":"1","status":"PUBLISHED","body":"With the warm weather and sunshine Mother Nature's been blessing us with (probably to make up for that eternal winter), painting our digits another shade of nude or black would be a crime. Hey, we've got nothing against our go-to hues, but \u2014 &lt;em&gt;yawn&lt;\/em&gt;. That's why we're so excited to give our tips a springtime update with nail expert Madeline Poole's fresh color combos. \n\n&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;\nPoole's pairings throw the rules of color coordination out the window. Sparks Fly, a glittery blue, meets a nude Camelflage*, and a turquoise Dive In befriends an eggplant Pat On The Black \u2014 all shades from Sally Hansen's Complete Salon Manicure\u2122, Triple Shine\u2122, and I Heart Nail Art lines \u2014 and we can't get enough. She's even giving the classic French tip a color update with gray and neon yellow for a mani that's anything but ordinary. Watch above for five totally unexpected, but totally cool, combos that'll give your tips a spring awakening. \n&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;small&gt;&lt;em&gt;*Available in June.&lt;\/em&gt;&lt;\/small&gt;\n\n\n&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;!-- START HTML ASSET --&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;div class=\"fblike-box-beauty\"&gt;&lt;div class=\"fb-like-box\" data-href=\"https:\/\/www.facebook.com\/R29Beauty\" data-width=\"292\" data-show-faces=\"false\" data-header=\"false\" data-stream=\"false\" data-show-border=\"false\" ref=\"inline-page-beauty\"&gt;&lt;\/div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;small&gt;Like this post? Hey, we've got nothing against our go-to hues, but \u2014 &lt;em&gt;yawn&lt;\/em&gt;. That's why we're so excited to give our tips a springtime update with nail expert Madeline Poole's fresh color combos. \n\n&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;\nPoole's pairings throw the rules of color coordination out the window. Sparks Fly, a glittery blue, meets a nude Camelflage*, and a turquoise Dive In befriends an eggplant Pat On The Black \u2014 all shades from Sally Hansen's Complete Salon Manicure\u2122, Triple Shine\u2122, and I Heart Nail Art lines \u2014 and we can't get enough. She's even giving the classic French tip a color update with gray and neon yellow for a mani that's anything but ordinary. Sparks Fly, a glittery blue, meets a nude Camelflage*, and a turquoise Dive In befriends an eggplant Pat On The Black \u2014 all shades from Sally Hansen's Complete Salon Manicure\u2122, Triple Shine\u2122, and I Heart Nail Art lines \u2014 and we can't get enough. And, if you're like us (not even a little ambidextrous), it's easy to give new meaning to finger painting. We may be all for coloring outside the lines in life, but when it comes to our nails, the slapdash look just isn't cutting it.\n&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;\nSure, we could keep 'em polished with weekly trips to the salon, but we'd rather save our dollars for that much-needed (&lt;del&gt;wanted&lt;\/del&gt;) shopping spree and DIY our own nails \u2014 that is, if we could paint like pros.\n&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;\nGood news: Mastering an epic mani is way easier than it looks. Even better? Ambidexterity is not required.\n&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;\nJust watch the tutorial above as our model Carolan layers on color with her nondominant hand. All it takes is a few swipes of Sally Hansen Triple Shine\u2122 polish and a few of the industry's best kept secrets. Get excited, guys. Your next at-home mani will look just like it's from a fancy-schmancy salon. We may be all for coloring outside the lines in life, but when it comes to our nails, the slapdash look just isn't cutting it.\n&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;\nSure, we could keep 'em polished with weekly trips to the salon, but we'd rather save our dollars for that much-needed (&lt;del&gt;wanted&lt;\/del&gt;) shopping spree and DIY our own nails \u2014 that is, if we could paint like pros.\n&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;\nGood news: Mastering an epic mani is way easier than it looks. Hey, don't get us wrong! We're just saying that it could use some zhushing. That's why we're updating the look with two easy braids and giving you the know-how to master it yourself. \n\n&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;\n\nThe trick is to work in a bit of Neutrogena&lt;sup&gt;\u00ae&lt;\/sup&gt; Triple Repair Fortifying Leave-In Treatment, part of the Neutrogena&lt;sup&gt;\u00ae&lt;\/sup&gt; Triple Repair Hair Care system, to strengthen strands as you're styling 'em. Even though you're not using heat here, keeping your tresses healthy with the shampoo, conditioner, and leave-in treatment trio is just as important as the hairstyle you're replicating.\n\n\n&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;\n\n\nLearn how to take your knot up a notch with two simple plaits in the video above, and don't be surprised if you find yourself braiding on the reg.\n\n&lt;img src=\"http:\/\/ad.doubleclick.net\/ddm\/trackimp\/N8340.127806.REFINERY29.COM\/B8001546.107691800;dc_trk_aid=280911169;dc_trk_cid=57638425;ord=[timestamp]?\"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;!-- START HTML ASSET --&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;div class=\"fblike-box-beauty\"&gt;&lt;div class=\"fb-like-box\" data-href=\"https:\/\/www.facebook.com\/R29Beauty\" data-width=\"292\" data-show-faces=\"false\" data-header=\"false\" data-stream=\"false\" data-show-border=\"false\" ref=\"inline-page-beauty\"&gt;&lt;\/div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;small&gt;Like this post? Hey, don't get us wrong! We're just saying that it could use some zhushing. That's why we're updating the look with two easy braids and giving you the know-how to master it yourself. \n\n&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;\n\nThe trick is to work in a bit of Neutrogena&lt;sup&gt;\u00ae&lt;\/sup&gt; Triple Repair Fortifying Leave-In Treatment, part of the Neutrogena&lt;sup&gt;\u00ae&lt;\/sup&gt; Triple Repair Hair Care system, to strengthen strands as you're styling 'em. Even though you're not using heat here, keeping your tresses healthy with the shampoo, conditioner, and leave-in treatment trio is just as important as the hairstyle you're replicating.\n\n\n&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;\n\n\nLearn how to take your knot up a notch with two simple plaits in the video above, and don't be surprised if you find yourself braiding on the reg.\n\n&lt;img src=\"http:\/\/ad.doubleclick.net\/ddm\/trackimp\/N8340.127806.REFINERY29.COM\/B8001546.107691800;dc_trk_aid=280911169;dc_trk_cid=57638425;ord=[timestamp]?\"&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;"},{"type":"widget:legacy","content":{"resource":"&lt;!-- START HTML ASSET --&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;div class=\"fblike-box-beauty\"&gt;&lt;div class=\"fb-like-box\" data-href=\"https:\/\/www.facebook.com\/R29Beauty\" data-width=\"292\" data-show-faces=\"false\" data-header=\"false\" data-stream=\"false\" data-show-border=\"false\" ref=\"inline-page-beauty\"&gt;&lt;\/div&gt;&lt;br&gt;&lt;small&gt;Like this post? That's why we're updating the look with two easy braids and giving you the know-how to master it yourself. \n\n&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;\n\nThe trick is to work in a bit of Neutrogena&lt;sup&gt;\u00ae&lt;\/sup&gt; Triple Repair Fortifying Leave-In Treatment, part of the Neutrogena&lt;sup&gt;\u00ae&lt;\/sup&gt; Triple Repair Hair Care system, to strengthen strands as you're styling 'em. replicating.\n\n\n&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;\n\n\nLearn how to take your knot up a notch with two simple plaits in the video above, and don't be surprised if you find yourself braiding on the More like the \"Oh, crap, I hit snooze way too many times and now I'm late for my huge presentation\" way.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;\n\nAs much as we love artfully disheveled strands and beachy texture, we get that sometimes you just want to tame that frizz and make your mane a more polished affair. Fortunately, as easy as it is to get frizz, it's just as easy to get rid of it. All you need is some mousse, a blowdryer with a diffuser attachment, and this video tutorial. Waves","published":"1385878500","type":"VIDEO","basename":"curling-iron","pages":"1","status":"PUBLISHED","body":"How is it that one of the most basic of hair tools can easily be the most intimidating? To us, the curling iron represents a world of endless style possibilities \u2014 if only we weren't so wary of ending up looking like a pageant girl gone wrong. But, now we're kicking ourselves for lack of trying: If we had known how to wield a curling iron like  &lt;em&gt;this&lt;\/em&gt;, we'd have rescued the once-terrifying tool from the depths of our beauty cabinet long ago.\n&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;\nSo, though we mourn the loss of good hair days that could have been, we're looking forward to a future filled with bouncy, beachy, beautiful hair that looks anything but contrived. \n&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;\nLike what you see? Perfectly","published":"1383589800","type":"VIDEO","basename":"fishtail-braid","pages":"1","status":"PUBLISHED","body":"Not to brag, but our greatest childhood accomplishment was mastering the French braid. Little did we know, it would\u2019ve been way more beneficial to learn how to fishtail \u2014 the bohemian hairstyle has been a runway hit season after season. Luckily, it\u2019s never too late to learn something new, especially because this style isn't going away anytime soon. Think it looks too tricky to master? That's the best part \u2014 once you get the hang of the two-strand concept, we're guessing you'll be amazed by how easy it is. Watch now for our guide to creating the perfect fishtail braid, every time. \n&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;\n\nLike what you see? Check out more how-to videos in our new series, &lt;a href=\"\/beauty-prep-school\"&gt;Beauty Prep School&lt;\/a&gt;.","sections":{"body":[{"type":"text","content":"Not to brag, but our greatest childhood accomplishment was mastering the French braid. Little did we know, it would\u2019ve been way more beneficial to learn how to fishtail \u2014 the bohemian hairstyle has been a runway hit season after season. Luckily, it\u2019s never too late to learn something new, especially because this style isn't going away anytime soon. Think it looks too tricky to master? That's the best part \u2014 once you get the hang of the two-strand concept, we're guessing you'll be amazed by how easy it is. So, considering our love of lacquer, we want to be sure those gates are gleaming. But, in a world of endless balms, oils, and tools intended specifically to care for our nail beds, it's not always easy to know where to start. Go at them without the proper prep work, and you can suffer the consequences. Aesthetics aside, if cared for improperly, cuticles can become an entry point for harmful bacteria. No, thanks.\n&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;\nThat being said, there's no better time to learn how to give your cuticles the love they deserve.   var val;

   {

      s = r29cookie.substring(i + 12);

      }
      else {

    (function(){
      function loadChartbeat() {
        window._sf_endpt=(new Date()).getTime();
        var e = document.createElement('script');
        e.setAttribute('language', 'javascript');
        e.setAttribute('type', 'text/javascript');
        e.setAttribute('src',
           (('https:' == document.location.protocol) ? 'https://a248.e.akamai.net/chartbeat.download.akamai.com/102508/' : 'http://static.chartbeat.com/') +
           'js/chartbeat_pub.js');
        document.body.appendChild(e);
      }
      var oldonload = window.onload;
      window.onload = (typeof window.onload != 'function') ?
         loadChartbeat : function() { oldonload(); loadChartbeat(); };
    })();
